fact_check_explanation_title: This viral coronavirus breathing advice needs context
fact_check_explanation_summary: A viral video on how to relieve Covid-19 symptoms won’t necessarily give appropriate advice in all cases.

fact_check_explanation_title: This viral voice message about ambulances shared on WhatsApp is inaccurate
fact_check_explanation_summary: The message, which says ambulances won’t be sent to people struggling to breathe, and the government will prevent all outside exercise from “next week”, is incorrect.

fact_check_explanation_title: Most people do not need to keep their cats indoors during the new coronavirus outbreak
fact_check_explanation_summary: British Veterinary Association advice to keep cats indoors applies only to cats from infected or self-isolating households.

fact_check_explanation_title: No, a survey didn’t find a majority of doctors saying that hydroxychloroquine is the most effective treatment for Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: The poll was not representative of all doctors. 37% of doctors involved in Covid-19 treatment listed these drugs as among the most -effective treatments.

fact_check_explanation_title: How many people have been evicted as a result of coronavirus?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Housing charity Shelter says there has been a spike in evictions due to all reasons, though not as large a spike as found in a recent survey.

fact_check_explanation_title: Claims about Swansea nurses dying in intensive care were false
fact_check_explanation_summary: The claim that three nurses had died in a Swansea ITU, presumably from Covid-19, was false.

fact_check_explanation_title: What do we know about cats and the new coronavirus?
fact_check_explanation_summary: A tiger has tested positive for Covid-19, but there’s currently no evidence that cats (big or small) can pass the new coronavirus to humans.

fact_check_explanation_title: A tweet claiming the Prime Minister has died is fake
fact_check_explanation_summary: This was claimed by a fake BBC Breaking News Twitter account.

fact_check_explanation_title: £20 notes don’t have a secret message about 5G and coronavirus
fact_check_explanation_summary: The so-called 5G tower is actually Margate lighthouse, and there’s no evidence 5G can hurt you.

fact_check_explanation_title: This video of body bags in a hospital was not filmed in St Mary’s, London
fact_check_explanation_summary: The hospital trust confirmed to us that it wasn’t filmed at St Mary’s and fact checkers have found it was filmed in Ecuador.

fact_check_explanation_title: This video supposedly showing Covid-19 patients at St Mary’s Hospital, London was actually filmed in Madrid
fact_check_explanation_summary: A video sent by a reader was claimed to show Covid-19 patients lying on the floor of St Mary’s Hospital, London. The video was actually filmed in two different Madrid …

fact_check_explanation_title: NHS Nightingale does not want art in the post
fact_check_explanation_summary: “Rainbows for Nightingale” was an unofficial appeal for art in the post that spread widely on social media.
